title: Flatland  (Ladd Ehlinger, 2007)
description:
This is the full length movie made by Ladd Ehlinger in 2007, based on Edwin A. Abbott's book: Flatland: A Romance of Many Dimensions (1884).

Edwin Abbott Abbott was a schoolmaster and an authority on the 'social classes' of Victorian societies. His book is a satire, as well as the definitive work to begin to understand dimensions)

There have been several attempts to make a movie based on this awesome book, and finally, this one has succeeded in being complete and faithful to the book.

It is animated, naturally.

I guess they couldn't find any two-dimensional squares, triangles or hexagons, or three dimensional spheres, to be the actors. 

The book is quite enjoyable too. It is OK for high school level students, especially math students.

This film had the masterful screenwriting of Prof. Tom Whalen, to make it possible. 

You can read the full text of the book, including original illustrations, here: http://www.ibiblio.org/eldritch/eaa/FL.HTM 

You can also get it at many public libraries (do they still have those?)

It will give you an easy way to comprehend just what dimensions are, in a strict mathematical sense, without any metaphysical or other interpretations.

Just remember to always be nice to your lines -- or she can cut you to pieces!

Enjoy!

And please be sure to seed it for awhile.  

   --H2oDragon

PS: If you really like it and want to contribute something, look up Ladd Ehlinger's Flatland movie webpage, and send him a few bucks...or buy the CD!

Keep torrents alive!
